title.rendered: Eastern Air Lines in  Florida, United States

content.rendered:
Eastern Air Lines, also colloquially known as Eastern, was a major American airline from 1926 to 1991. Before its dissolution, it was headquartered at Miami International Airport in an unincorporated area of Miami-Dade County, Florida.

Eastern was one of the “Big Four” domestic airlines created by the Spoils Conferences of 1930, and was headed by World War I flying ace Eddie Rickenbacker in its early years. It had a near monopoly in air travel between New York and Florida from the 1930s until the 1950s and dominated this market for decades afterward.

Eastern Air Lines in Florida, United States Address, Phone, Email, Fax, Working hours and Website

Address: New York City
Dade County, Florida

Phone: +1 855-216-7601

Fax: NA

Email id: customersupport@goeasternair.com

For media inquiries email: marketing@goeasternair.com

For lost baggage or items: baggage@goeasternair.com

Eastern Air Lines Official website: https://iflyea.com/

Eastern Air Lines Check In

  • Airport check in opens four hours prior to departure.
  • Eastern recommends arriving to the airport at least four (4) hours before our flight’s scheduled departure time.
  • Our flights close 60 minutes prior to departure.

Types of Planes / Air craft available with Eastern Air Lines

Fleet size: 304

  • Airbus A300B2
  • Airbus A300B4

  • Boeing 720

Eastern Air Lines Baggage Allowance

View Eastern Air LinesHand | Cabin baggage, Checked baggage, Excess baggage charges, over weight baggage charges, over size baggage charges in the above link.

Queries handled by Eastern Air Lines Customer care:

Flight Ticket Booking, Ticket Cancellation, Flight Ticket Rescheduling, Ok to Board, Visa Services, Online Check-in, Baggage Allowance, Duty Free Allowance, Flight Information, Airport Lounges, Visa Information, In-Flight Meals, Airport Transfers, Missing Luggage, Immigration Services, Valet Parking, Meet and Greet, Flight Wifi, Airport Wifi, In-Flight Entertainment, Airport Facilities, Delayed Flights, Visa on Arrival, First Class, Business Class, Economy Class, OnePass
